Source   Edit  

Types and procs for dealing with music notes and also note-to-frequency lookup.

Types

Letter = range[0 .. 11]
Note letter as an integer range. 0 is C, 1 is C#, ... 11 is B Source   Edit   
NoiseNote = range[0 .. 59]
Note index range for a noise note (Noise notes are only played on channel 4). A noise note ranges from octaves 2 to 6, but the actual note played maps to a frequency setting in the noiseNoteTable. Source   Edit   
NoteIndex = uint8
Index type that refers to a note in a lookup table. Source   Edit   
NotePair = object
  letter*: Letter
  octave*: Octave
Note represented as a pair of a Letter and Octave. Source   Edit   
NoteRange = range[0 .. high(ToneNote) + 1]
Full note range, including special note indices. The full range is 7 octaves (84 notes) with 1 special note index (cut), for a total of 85 indices. Source   Edit   
NoteType = enum
  tone, noise
Enum of the possible note kinds:
  • tone: playable on channels 1, 2 and 3
  • noise: playable on channel 4
Source   Edit   
Octave = range[2 .. 8]
Available octave range of TrackerBoy notes Source   Edit   
ToneNote = range[0 .. 83]
Note index range for a tone note (Tone notes are played on channels 1, 2 and 3). A tone note ranges from octaves 2 to 8, with C-2 being approx 64 Hz Source   Edit  

Consts

A = 9
Note of A at any octave. Source   Edit   
AFlat = 8
Ab, Same as GSharp. Source   Edit   
ASharp = 10
Note of A#/Bb at any octave. Source   Edit   
B = 11
Note of B at any octave. Source   Edit   
BFlat = 10
Bb, Same as ASharp. Source   Edit   
C = 0
Note of C at any octave. Source   Edit   
CSharp = 1
Note of C#/Db at any octave. Source   Edit   
D = 2
Note of D at any octave. Source   Edit   
DFlat = 1
Db, same as CSharp. Source   Edit   
DSharp = 3
Note of D#/Eb at any octave. Source   Edit   
E = 4
Note of E at any octave. Source   Edit   
EFlat = 3
Eb, same as DSharp. Source   Edit   
F = 5
Note of F at any octave. Source   Edit   
FSharp = 6
Note of F#/Gb at any octave. Source   Edit   
G = 7
Note of G at any octave. Source   Edit   
GFlat = 6
Gb, Same as FSharp. Source   Edit   
GSharp = 8
Note of G#/Ab at any octave. Source   Edit   
noteCut = 84'u
Special note index for a note cut. When used the channel will be silenced by disabling the DAC. Source   Edit  

Procs

func lookupNoiseNote(note: Natural): uint8 {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Lookup the noise value or NR43 setting for the given note index. note is clamped within the bounds of NoiseNote. Source   Edit   
func lookupToneNote(note: Natural): uint16 {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Lookup the frequency value for the given note index. note is clamped within the bounds of ToneNote. Source   Edit   
func notePair(letter: Letter; octave: Octave): NotePair {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Construct a note pair with the given components. Source   Edit   
func toNote(i: int): NoteIndex {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Convert an integer index to a note index, clamping if necessary. Source   Edit   
func toNote(letter: Letter; octave: Octave): NoteIndex {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Convert a note at a given octave to a note index. Source   Edit   
func toNote(p: NotePair): NoteIndex {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Convert the note pair to a note index. Source   Edit   
func toPair(index: NoteIndex): NotePair {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Convert a note index into a letter and octave pairing. Source   Edit
